page.title: 15Recreation in Caerhun Parish
page.content: Walking is a very popular activity. Other pastimes include gardening and do-it-yourself activities. The local extra-mural classes run by Bangor University are well-supported. Rowen Village Hall is the venue for many activities such as country dancing classes, snooker, whist drives, bingo sessions, coffee evenings and bring-and-buy sales. There are no purpose-built recreational facilities, sports centres or playing fields in this area. The village inn, the Ty Gwyn, is a popular meeting place, especially for the young people and newcomers in the vicinity. Blackburn Education Authority owns Bron-y-Gader on the slopes of Penygadair and use it as an outdoor pursuits centre for their school pupils.
